title: Judge to decide in April whether to delay prison for Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes
description: Holmes was sentenced to 11 years in prison for defrauding investors out of more than $100 million. Now, she has asked a judge to remain free on bail until her appeal is heard.

title: They performed with Bono and The Edge (after their parents told them who they are)
description: Or perhaps Bono and The Edge performed with them.

title: Read the transcript: What happened inside the federal hearing on abortion pills
description: Read the transcript from Wednesday's hearing before Judge Matthew Kacsmaryk in a federal case that could decide the future of access to a major abortion pill.

title: Ohio becomes latest Republican state to leave a key voting data partnership
description: Six GOP-led states have now pulled out of the Electronic Registration Information Center, despite it being considered one of the best tools states have to detect voter fraud.

title: Lance Reddick, star of 'John Wick' and 'The Wire,' dead at 60
description: Reddick was found dead at his Los Angeles home Friday. He died of natural causes.

title: After this week's bank failures, some encouraging signs, but worries persist
description: A look back on the past week in banking news, explained.

title: Here's what the latest version of ChatGPT gets right — and wrong
description: Open AI released a new version of ChatGPT this week. It claims GPT-4 is more powerful than ever, and could even do your taxes. But a quick test drive revealed some problems.

title: Locals look for silver linings as Amazon hits pause on its new HQ
description: Amazon's announcement of a pause in development of its second headquarters, in suburban Washington, D.C., is raising questions about the impact on the local economy.

title: New Orleans Police Department taps civilians amid an officer shortage
description: Many police departments accept they may never get the number of officers they used to have. The New Orleans PD is "retooling" for a new reality that includes handing some duties to civilians.

title: Recruiting troubles accelerate Army's plan to bring back 'Be All You Can Be'
description: Faced with a recruiting crisis, the Army has dusted off one of its most popular slogans: "Be All You Can Be."  But will that prove popular with a new generation of potential recruits?

title: What to watch for after a volatile week on Wall Street
description: Markets have been volatile since Silicon Valley Bank collapsed, amid fears of wider problems with the banking system. Days away from a critical Federal Reserve meeting, they're even more on edge.

title: Cyclone Freddy shattered records. People lost everything. How does the healing begin?
description: The countries hit by this unprecedented storm now must  help survivors who may have lost nearly everything. We talk to an aid worker on the ground in Mozambique for insights.

title: What is Babesiosis? A rare tick-borne disease is on the rise in the Northeast
description: Lyme Disease isn't the only tick-driven illness that residents of the northeast should worry about. The CDC says cases of Babesiosis, which can cause flu-like symptoms, are on the rise in 8 states.

title: WHO calls on China to share data on raccoon dog link to pandemic. Here's what we know
description: Data was released briefly, then rescinded. As NPR reported previously, there is already strong evidence pointing to these animals in the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market in Wuhan.

title: Ford recalls 1.5 million vehicles over problems with brake hoses and windshield wipers
description: The automaker is recalling nearly 1.3 million 2013-2018 Ford Fusion and Lincoln MKZ sedans, as well as 220,000 F-150 pickups from 2021. Here's what to do if your vehicle might be affected.

title: Turkey says it will ratify Finland's bid to join NATO
description: "NATO will become stronger with Finland's membership and thus, I believe, will play an active role in maintaining global security and stability," Turkey's president said Friday.

title: The International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for Putin
description: The ICC has issued warrants for the Russian president and his children's rights commissioner for alleged war crimes involving accusations that Russia has forcibly taken Ukrainian children.

title: Biden wants Congress to boost penalties for executives when mid-sized banks fail
description: President Biden said the current law limits his administration's power to hold executives responsible when mid-sized banks fail due to mismanagement.

title: Clinics on wheels bring doctors and dentists to health care deserts
description: Health care vans that provided COVID testing and vaccines in the pandemic are now providing a range of health services in hard-to-reach communities. New access to federal funds could expand the trend.

title: The third season of 'Ted Lasso' basks in the glow of its quirky characters
description: Jason Sudeikis' Ted Lasso returns as folksy as ever, but one wonders if there is enough ah shucks personality to carry the series to a compelling end.

title: Robert Smith of The Cure convinces Ticketmaster to give partial refunds, lower fees
description: The announcement came a day after Smith shared his frustrations with Ticketmaster, saying he was "as sickened as you all are" by the company's fees.

title: Russia awards pilots involved in confrontation with a U.S. drone over Black Sea
description: The United States accused Russia of an "unsafe" and "unprofessional" intercept of its MQ-9 Reaper surveillance drone that forced it to be brought down over the Black Sea this week

title: China's leader Xi Jinping will meet with Russia's Vladimir Putin in Moscow next week
description: Moscow said the long-anticipated visit is coming at the invitation of President Vladimir Putin. The talks are expected to focus on the war in Ukraine, though it wasn't mentioned explicitly.

title: Michigan Democrats are getting their way for the first time in nearly 40 years
description: For the first time in decades, Democrats run the show in Michigan, passing legislative priorities they've been after for years: repealing a 1931 abortion law, repealing right-to-work and more.

title: 'Poverty, By America' shows how the rest of us benefit by keeping others poor
description: Pulitzer winner for Evicted Matthew Desmond examines why the U.S. has more poverty than other rich nations. He finds it spends big on social programs, but gives the most to those who need it least.

title: Volcanic activity on Venus spotted in radar images, scientists say
description: Data from an old NASA spacecraft reveals a volcano erupted on the surface of Venus in 1991, a new study in Science says.

title: Biden has big ideas for fixing child care. For now a small workaround will have to do
description: The administration is turning to semiconductors in the hopes of expanding affordable child care.

title: 'Back to one meal a day': SNAP benefits drop as food prices climb
description: A lot of people don't think twice about buying milk, says Teresa Calderez. "But there are lots of us out here who can't buy a gallon of milk when we need it."

title: New Zealand lawmakers banned from TikTok amid data use fears
description: New Zealand lawmakers and other workers inside the nation's Parliament will be banned from having the TikTok app on their government phones, officials said Friday.

title: Trains derail in Arizona and Washington, with oil spilled on Puget Sound tribal land
description: The derailment in Washington state occurred on a berm along Padilla Bay, on the Swinomish tribal reservation near Anacortes. Most of 5,000 gallons of spilled diesel fuel leaked on the land.

title: Jim Gordon, a famed session drummer who killed mother, dies
description: Jim Gordon, the famed session drummer who backed Eric Clapton and The Beach Boys before being diagnosed with schizophrenia and going to prison for killing his mother, has died. He was 77.
